channel.title: CVE Feed for SUSE -- supportutils
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SUSE -- supportutils

item.title: CVE-2018-19636|2024-09-17T04:03:59.444Z -- suse -- supportutils
item.description: Supportutils, before version 3.1-5.7.1, when run with command line argument -A searched the file system for a ndspath binary. If an attacker provides one at an arbitrary location it is executed with root privileges

item.title: CVE-2018-19640|2024-09-17T01:45:58.729Z -- suse -- supportutils
item.description: If the attacker manages to create files in the directory used to collect log files in supportutils before version 3.1-5.7.1 (e.g. with CVE-2018-19638) he can kill arbitrary processes on the local machine.

item.title: CVE-2018-19638|2024-09-17T00:06:09.548Z -- suse -- supportutils
item.description: In supportutils, before version 3.1-5.7.1 and if pacemaker is installed on the system, an unprivileged user could have overwritten arbitrary files in the directory that is used by supportutils to collect the log files.
